articles.title: S. Korean Regime Blasted for Scattering Leaflets Defaming Dignity of DPRK
articles.content:
S. Korean Regime Blasted for Scattering Leaflets Defaming Dignity of DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet regime on Sept. 21 let human scum of the "Alliance for the Movement of Free North", the organization of the vicious "defectors from the north", scatter leaflets defaming the DPRK.
					 A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea in a statement on September 22 condemned this leaflet-scattering operation as a blatant challenge to the patient efforts of the DPRK for the improvement of the relations with the south and the resumption of the dialogue and an unpardonable mockery and insult to all the Koreans and the public at home and abroad desirous of the national reconciliation and unity and the peace on the Korean peninsula and its reunification.
					
					 It continued:
					
					 It is the south Korean puppet regime which is chiefly to blame for the leaflet-scattering operation.
					
					 Such operation was conducted in the place near Inchon where the 17th Asian Games are now under way in which the DPRK's players' group is also taking part.
					
					 This fact clearly proves that the south Korean puppet clique is hordes of hooligans without equals as it is chilling the atmosphere of reconciliation and reunification prevailing in the games in pursuance of confrontation with the north, being utterly indifferent to the international games and the sincerity of the fellow countrymen participating in the games.
					
					  If the puppet regime persistently patronizes the leaflet scattering operation of the human scum by covering it up with such veils as "nature of the social system" and "freedom of non-governmental organization" and the like, the inter-Korean relations will never improve but it will only bring a catastrophe.
					
					 Scattering leaflets against the other party is publicly recognized as an act of war by international law.
					
					 Those who masterminded the operation for scattering leaflets slandering the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and others involved in it will never go scot-free and the DPRK will take a resolute retaliatory measure any time to force them to pay dearly for it.
					
					 Our measure for mercilessly punishing them will be taken on behalf of all Koreans any moment, anywhere and by any means and method. 
					
					 The south Korean puppet regime should bear in mind that it can no longer pay lip service to such words as "dialogue" and "confidence."

articles.title: Talks between Delegations of WPK and Mongolian People's Party Held
articles.content:
Talks between Delegations of WPK and Mongolian People's Party Held
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Talks between delegations of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) and the Mongolian People's Party took place at the building of the People's Party on Sept. 20. 
					 Present at the talks from the WPK side were members of the delegation of the WPK led by Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, and the DPRK ambassador to Mongolia, and from the opposite side were members of the delegation of the Mongolian People's Party led by General Secretary J. Munkhbat, and the Mongolian ambassador to the DPRK.
					
					 The general secretary said that the visit to Mongolia by the WPK delegation marked an important occasion in developing the 60-odd-year-long friendly relations between the two countries. 
					
					 He expressed the will to make a positive contribution to boosting the traditional multifaceted exchange and cooperation between the two parties and countries.
					
					 The general secretary gave a reception in honor of the WPK delegation on the same day.
					
					 The delegation toured various places in the capital city and provinces of Mongolia.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Mali
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Mali 
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greeting to Ibrahim Boubacar Keita, president of the Republic of Mali, on the occasion of the 54th anniversary of the proclamation of the Republic. 
					 The message expressed the belief that the good friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries with a long history and tradition would grow stronger. It wished the president and people of Mali bigger successes in the work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Wreaths Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Wreaths were laid before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Monday, the 65th anniversary of her demise.
					 Seen standing before the bust was a wreath sent by supreme leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were senior officials of the party, state and army, the chairperson of a friendly party, officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, the Cabinet, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, service personnel of the Korean People's Army (KPA) and the Korean People's Internal Security Forces (KPISF), working people, school youth and children in Pyongyang.
					
					 Wreaths were laid before the bust in the name of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK and the DPRK Cabinet.
					
					 Also placed before the bust were wreaths in the name of the Ministry of the People's Armed Forces, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, units of the KPA and KPISF, scientific, educational, public health and media institutions, national joint organization of the Korean Children's Union and party and power bodies, factories and farms in Pyongyang.
					
					 The participants observed a moment's silence, looking back on the revolutionary life of Kim Jong Suk.
					
					 Also laid before her statues at Kim Jong Suk County, Hoeryong City, Kim Jong Suk Naval University and Kim Jong Suk General Military Academy were floral baskets in the name of local party and power bodies, working people's organizations, units of the KPA and the KPISF, factories, enterprises, farms, schools, etc. and flowers on the same day. 
					
					 Meanwhile, the congratulatory group of Koreans in Japan and the chief of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front visited the bust of Kim Jong Suk at the cemetery and paid tribute to her.

articles.title: Honorary Titles, Orders, Medals to Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Honorary Titles, Orders, Medals to Kim Jong Suk
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk was awarded honorary titles, orders, medals, prizes and gifts by different countries for more than a decade.
					 The Women's International Democratic Federation and the Nepal Journalist Association registered her as their honorary members and honorary special members, prompted by their desire to hand down to posterity the exploits performed by her.
					
					 The Applied Ecology Institute of Peru conferred upon her the title of its honorary chairwoman while San Miguel de Ibarra City of Imbabura Province, Ecuador the honorary title of "Great Teachers."
					
					 The French Institute for the Fidelity in Work conferred a gold medal and honorary certificate upon her.
					
					 The National Association of Writers and Artists of Peru presented her with great medal "Sun of the National Association of Writers and Artists of Peru" and its certificate. They reflect profound reverence of the Peruvian people for her. 
					
					 The "Contribution to Victory" Organizing Committee of the International Commemoration Movement of Russia awarded her the Social Order "Contribution to Victory", the League of Experts for Egyptian Cultural and International Civilization Dialogue the prize depicting a man upholding the earth and a certificate praising her exploits and the Nepal Journalist Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Politics the "Nepalese International Peace Prize" with due ceremonies.
					
					 Various cities of Mexico, Ecuador and Peru registered her as their honorary citizens.
					
					 The Russian Union of Writers in the book "Great Banner of Victory" carried songs praising President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk, illustrated with photos documenting their revolutionary activities.
					
					 The general manager of a Mongolian company toured revolutionary battle sites and revolutionary sites in the DPRK to write the book "Kim Jong Suk, Woman Commander of Mt. Paektu."
					
					 The Voluntad Publishing House of Ecuador brought out the book "Kim Jong Suk, Illustrious Commander of Mt. Paektu."
					
					 There are also books titled "Ode to General Kim Jong Suk", "Anti-Japanese War Hero Kim Jong Suk" and "Fly toward Sun".
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt created a poem "She will always be remembered by us".
					
					 Epic "Kim Jong Suk, Rays of Sun", "A Pocketbook of Woman Commander" and other works created by foreigners deal with the feats and noble traits of her who glorified her great revolutionary life.

articles.title: Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Visit Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Participants in Pyongyang Int'l Film Festival Visit Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The participants in the 14th Pyongyang International Film Festival visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Being briefed on the revolutionary career of the President and his family members, they went round historic relics preserved at the old home in Mangyongdae.
					
					 Mikhail Koshrev Nestserov, chairman of the international jury, said:
					
					 I was deeply impressed to hear that the President was born into a simple and ordinary family. He devoted all his life to the sacred cause for the people.
					
					 Kuenzman Patrick, member of the French delegation, noted that the President was a great revolutionary who defeated U.S. and Japanese imperialism.
					
					 The participants also toured the Tower of the Juche Idea, the Arch of Triumph, the National Gifts Exhibition House, the Victorious Fatherland Liberation War Museum, the Mirim Riding Club, etc.

articles.title: 10th Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair Opens
articles.content:
10th Pyongyang Autumn Int'l Trade Fair Opens
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The 10th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair opened with due ceremony at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Monday.
					 Present at the opening ceremony were Vice-Premier Ro Tu Chol who doubles as chairman of the State Planning Commission, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of External Economic Relations, Kim Song Dok, vice-chairman of the Pyongyang City People's Committee, Ri Hak Gwon, head of the DPRK Chamber of Commerce, officials in the field of foreign trade, delegations of different countries and regions, foreign diplomatic envoys and staff members of their embassies here.
					
					  Pak Ung Sik, director of the Korean International Exhibition Corporation, made an opening address which was followed by a congratulatory speech by Ri Myong San, vice-minister of External Economic Relations.
					
					 The speakers said the fair would offer a good opportunity to promote friendship and cooperation among countries and boost the wide-ranging economic and trade transactions and scientific and technological exchange. 
					
					 They expressed the will to boost bilateral and multilateral cooperation with various countries and regions of the world in the fields of the economy and foreign trade on the principle of equality and mutual benefit in the days ahead.
					
					 The participants looked round products presented by companies of various countries and regions including the DPRK, Germany, Russia, Malaysia, Mongolia, Singapore, China, Cuba, Italy and Taipei of China.
					
					 The fair will run through Thursday.

articles.title: DPRK Weightlifter Set New Record in Asian Games
articles.content:
DPRK Weightlifter Set New Record in Asian Games
 Inchon, September 21 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Un Guk, People's Sportsman of the DPRK, won a gold medal in the 62 kg category of men's weightlifting on Sunday in the 17th Asian Games.
					 At first snatch he easily lifted 147 kg, the record he set in 16th Asian games. Although this was 2 kg more than the one set by other players, he set about setting a new record.
					
					 At second and third snatches he lifted 152 and 154 kg, setting new Asian and world records.
					
					 At first jerk he lifted 170kg. He also succeeded in lifting 174 and 178 kg at the successive events, renewing the record (327kg) he set in the 2012 London Olympic Games by lifting 328 and 332 kg in total points.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK judoists bagged bronze medals; Hong Kuk Hyon (man)  in 73kg, Kim Sol Mi (woman) in 48kg and Ri Hyo Sun (woman) in  57kg category respectively.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Pukchang Thermal Power Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Pukchang Thermal Power Complex
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Pukchang Thermal Power Complex.
					 Going round various places of the complex, he learned in detail about the supply of coal and encouraged the power producers.
					
					 There took place a consultative meeting on the spot. It discussed the issues of more scrupulously managing equipment and improving technical control and operating generators in full capacity.
					
					 He called upon the workers of the complex to continue glorifying the honor of pace-setters in attaining the target of electricity production set by the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 Meanwhile, the premier made a field survey of the coal deposit and production at the Jenam Coal Mine of the Tokchon Area Coal-Mining Complex. He underlined the need to increase the production by giving definite priority to capital and preparatory tunneling. He also called upon the Cabinet and relevant units to supply narrow gauged rails, wire ropes, pit props, etc. in time.
					
					 Going round the Pyongyang Metro and Pyongyang Department Store No. 1, he stressed the need to improve technological conditions of electric cars and produce varieties of quality light industrial products to meet the needs of people.

articles.title: Foreign Delegations, Delegates Here
articles.content:
Foreign Delegations, Delegates Here
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Foreign delegations and delegates arrived here Monday to take part in the international scientific symposium of Kim Il Sung University. They included a delegation of National University of Mongolia, delegation of People's University of China and other delegations and delegates of various universities of China, and delegate of University of Paris 7.
					 Also arriving here were Russian experts in Korean language.
					
					 Arriving earlier were a delegate of Berlin Free University of Germany, a delegation of the Yanbian Education Publishing House of China and a delegation of Korean University of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan.

articles.title: WPK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
WPK Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK) led by Kang Sok Ju, member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the WPK Central Committee, returned home Monday after visiting Germany, Belgium, Switzerland, Italy and Mongolia.

articles.title: DWUK Delegation Back Home
articles.content:
DWUK Delegation Back Home
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) led by Chae Chun Hui, vice-chairwoman of its Central Committee, returned home Monday after visiting Vietnam and Laos.

articles.title: New Stamp Issued in DPRK
articles.content:
New Stamp Issued in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The State Stamp Bureau of the DPRK issued a stamp (a sheet) on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of demise of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Seen on the upper part of the stamp are letters "Eternal Bodyguard." Seen also in its center is an oil painting "Personally Standing Sentinel" depicting Kim Jong Suk who devotedly protected the safety of President Kim Il Sung in the whole course of her revolutionary career.

articles.title: Service Personnel, Working People Visit House below Rock in Secret Camp on Mt. Okryon
articles.content:
Service Personnel, Working People Visit House below Rock in Secret Camp on Mt. Okryon
 Pujon, September 22 (KCNA) -- Service personnel, working people from all walks of life are visiting every day the house below rock in the Secret Camp on Mt. Okryon in reverence for anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 She went to the Pujon Pass Secret Base in August, Juche 26 (1937) and conducted activities to build a party organization in this area and expand and develop the movement for the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland.
					
					 Climbing the top of Mt. Okryon, she commanded a bird-eye's view of Pujon Plateau and underscored the need to firmly build the Pujon Pass Secret Base.
					
					 Service personnel, officials and working people in Pyongyang and South Hamgyong Province and students of various universities, including Kim Il Sung University, Kim Chaek University of Technology and Kim Hyong Jik University of Education, and many other units, more than 20 000 in all, have visited the house this year.

articles.title: DPRK Pays Attention to Making Convenient Sportswear
articles.content:
DPRK Pays Attention to Making Convenient Sportswear
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- New kinds of sportswear for various events have been recently produced in the DPRK.
					 They include clothes for marathoners and archers. 
					
					 Those sports clothes are very convenient for athletes' movements as they were designed to suit the specific features of every event.
					
					 Printed on every sportswear is an emblem depicting goshawk, the national bird of Korea.

articles.title: Demand for Unjong Tea Increases in DPRK
articles.content:
Demand for Unjong Tea Increases in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Unjong tea is gaining popularity among people in the DPRK.
					 The Unbangul Teahouse in Changgwang Street, Pyongyang is crowded with citizens eager to take the tea everyday.
					
					 Jong Kyong Hui, a waitress of the teahouse, told KCNA that the number of customers is increasing with each passing day.
					
					 Ryu Ryong Song, a citizen, said that Unjong tea with peculiar aroma helps relive stress.
					
					 Unjong tea is called Kangryong black tea and green tea in other way as it is cultivated in Kangryong County, South Hwanghae Province of the country.
					
					 The tea helps prevent arteriosclerosis, hypertension and cerebral thrombosis and strengthen heart function. It is specially efficacious for urination and aging.
					
					 The birth in the country of this tea tree, whose cultivation was considered to be hard in the area above 36 degrees North Latitude, was thanks to the tireless efforts of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 An official concerned said that big efforts are now directed to tea production and its processing to meet the increasing demand for it.

articles.title: Sports Achievements Delight DPRK People
articles.content:
Sports Achievements Delight DPRK People
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Sportspersons of the DPRK have proven successful in recent international games, delighting its citizens.
					 Some days ago, Yang Kyong Il of Kim Il Sung University bagged a gold medal at the 2014 World Wrestling Championships and the DPRK men's football team came first in the 2014 AFC U-16 Championship.
					
					 Weightlifters Om Yun Chol and Kim Un Guk won gold medals in the ongoing 17th Asian Games, setting new world records respectively.
					
					 In this regard, Kim Kwang Hyok, an official of Kim Il Sung University, told KCNA:
					
					 The teachers and students of the university extend warm thanks to those trustworthy sportspersons for having honored the country with gold medals in international games.
					
					 Hyon Nam, a workshop head of the Pyongyang Thermal Power Complex, said that all the workers of the complex have turned out to increase the output of electricity, encouraged by the sportspersons' achievements.
					
					 Jang Chon Bong, a chief coach of the Sajabong Sports Team, said that the happy news encouraged the athletes of the team to intensify their training for raising the nation's winter sports events to a higher level.
					
					 Kim Song Il, a researcher at the Branch Academy of Light Industrial Science under the State Academy of Sciences, said that he would take the lead in building a thriving nation as the local sportspersons did.

articles.title: U.S. Forces' Throw of Ammunition in Dumping Ground Disclosed in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Throw of Ammunition in Dumping Ground Disclosed in S. Korea 
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed that the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea threw ammunition into a dumping ground, according to the south Korean MBC on Sept. 18. 
					 This fact was disclosed when puppet policemen were searching for a business disposing of garbage from a unit of the U.S. forces in August last. 
					
					 An officer concerned of the business said that ammunition was found in the dumping ground of the firing range of the U.S. forces in the northern part of Kyonggi Province. 
					
					 Since long ago the U.S. imperialist forces in south Korea have let large quantities of oil and toxic substance leak from every place they are stationed and thrown defoliant and other toxic materials, seriously contaminating areas.
					
					 They made no scruple of secretly scrapping even a nuclear warhead in south Korea in 1972, causing an accident.

articles.title: DPRK's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Birthday Celebrated Abroad
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- There took place events in different countries to mark the 66th anniversary of the foundation of the DPRK.
					 They included meetings, photo exhibitions and film shows in Russia, Laos, DR Congo and Uganda from Sept. 4 to 9.
					
					 On display at the venues of the events were photos documenting undying feats President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un performed in the nation-building and their Songun leadership exploits.
					
					 Also displayed were photos showing the victorious and glorious path covered by the DPRK.
					
					 The chairman of the Russian Blagobeshensk Association for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism referred to the shining path covered by the DPRK under the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and the successes achieved by the Korean people in the building of a thriving nation under the leadership of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The political vice-rector of Kaysone Phomvihane Military Academy of Laos said that the meeting helped know better about the immortal feats the President performed by founding the DPRK and developing it into a strong socialist state.
					
					 The chairman of the National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea of DR Congo noted that the Korean people, once exploited and oppressed, could have their dreams and ideals translated into realities in the cradle of worthy life after the President founded the DPRK.
					
					 The stirring reality in the DPRK is instilling confidence in victory and courage into the world progressives struggling for socialism, he added.
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at a meeting held in Russia.

articles.title: Indian National Seminar Held to Mark DPRK's Birthday
articles.content:
Indian National Seminar Held to Mark DPRK's Birthday
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- There took place an Indian national seminar in New Delhi on Sept. 13 to mark the 66th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Displayed there were photos documenting the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 It was attended by personages of political, economic, academic and media circles of India, those of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea and members of the Juche idea study groups.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to India and his embassy officials.
					
					 Speeches were made by the chairman of the Delhi Rural Development Bureau, the chairman of the Indian Society for the Study of Works of Kim Jong Il, the director general of the Asian Regional Institute of the Juche Idea and others.
					
					 They said the President paved the way for building the people's government from the independent stand with the great ambition for building the people's country, not wedded to the ready-made theories and experience of other countries, and founded the DPRK, the first people's democratic state in the East, on Sept. 9, 1948.
					
					 They said Kim Jong Il formulated the Juche idea founded by the President as Kimilsungism and enforced the original Songun politics, defending the sovereignty of the country, developing it into the one with powerful military capabilities and ushering in a new era for building a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 Thanks to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Un, the DPRK has already ranked itself in the space powers and nuclear powers and registered eye-opening successes in building an economic power and highly civilized nation, they said, adding this is greatly encouraging the world revolutionary people desirous of socialism.
					
					 A letter to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the seminar.

articles.title: Kim Jong Suk Remembered in Britain, Guinea
articles.content:
Kim Jong Suk Remembered in Britain, Guinea
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- A seminar was held in Britain on Sept. 7 and a lecture given in Guinea on Sept. 15 in commemoration of the 65th anniversary of demise of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 The events were attended by figures and other people of the New Communist Party of Britain, Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist), Korean Friendship Association UK, the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and a company of Guinea.
					
					 The representative of the Korean Friendship Association UK said as follows:
					
					 She was born into a poor family and embarked upon the road of the struggle in her early years to liberate the country from the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 During the anti-Japanese war she was well known as a brave, kind-hearted woman general, who had a strong revolutionary spirit.
					
					 After the liberation of Korea, she encouraged the Korean people to turn out in the drive to build a new country true to the intention of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The greatest feat she performed for the country, revolution and people was that she brought leader Kim Jong Il up as the Shining Star of Mt. Paektu, providing a sure guarantee for accomplishing the revolutionary cause of Juche.
					
					 Kim Jong Suk passed away so early but she together with the President and Kim Jong Il is always remembered by the world progressives.
					
					 A member of the Central Committee of the Revolutionary Communist Party of Britain (Marxist-Leninist) said Kim Jong Suk was an indomitable revolutionary fighter who should be remembered forever not only by the Korean people but also by all revolutionaries of the world.
					
					 The chief of a project of a company of Guinea introduced in detail the brilliant revolutionary career of Kim Jong Suk who devotedly defended the President's idea and line, protecting his health and safety.

articles.title: Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Suk Observed by Foreign Media
articles.content:
Demise Anniversary of Kim Jong Suk Observed by Foreign Media
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- Media of Germany and Iran featured articles on Sept. 7 and 17 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of demise of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 An article titled "September 22, 1949, the anniversary of demise of Kim Jong Suk" was posted by the MS Travel Agency of Germany on its website. The article was illustrated with a photo of her statue.
					
					 Her life was so brief but she left an indelible trace in the mind of the Korean people.
					
					 She joined the Korean People's Revolutionary Army organized by President Kim Il Sung in September, 1935 and fought against the Japanese imperialists with arms.
					
					 She made great contributions to building a new country after the liberation of Korea.
					
					 She visited different parts of the country to arouse people to the struggle for implementing Kim Il Sung's line of nation-building.
					
					 She also made great contributions to consolidating the military foundation of new Korea.
					
					 She not only devoted herself to protecting the safety and good health of Kim Il Sung but also resolutely defended his idea and line.
					
					 She is always remembered by the Korean people as an incarnation devotedly defending the leader.
					
					 Iran News in an article titled "Brilliant life" praised Kim Jong Suk for performing undying exploits for the country, revolution and people.

articles.title: British Organizations Praise Kim Jong Suk's Exploits
articles.content:
British Organizations Praise Kim Jong Suk's Exploits
 Pyongyang, September 22 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea released a joint statement on September 14 on the occasion of the 65th anniversary of demise of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 The joint statement said:
					
					 65 years have passed since the demise of Kim Jong Suk but she is still remembered by not only the Korean people but also world progressives.
					
					 We boundlessly revere her as the great mother of Korea.
					
					 She participated in her early years in the anti-Japanese armed struggle organized by President Kim Il Sung and grew up to be an ardent revolutionary and anti-imperialist fighter.
					
					 She was a brave guerrilla with excellent marksmanship and a guard most loyal to Kim Il Sung.
					
					 She dedicated her all to building democratic Korea after its liberation and made tangible contributions to developing the Korean People's Revolutionary Army into a regular army.
					
					 She also took part in the work of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea and led women to turn out in the efforts for building a new country, free from the feudal yoke.
					
					 The greatest of her exploits is that she successfully brought up HE Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Her exploits will shine long in the mind of the followers of the Juche idea and the Songun idea.

articles.title: Conversaciones entre PTC y PPM
articles.content:
Conversaciones entre PTC y PPM
 Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 20 en la sede del Partido del Pueblo de Mongolia las conversaciones entre la delegacion del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y la del Partido del Pueblo de Mongolia.
					 En la ocasion participaron por la parte coreana los miembros de la delegacion del PTC presidida por Kang Sok Ju, miembro del Buro Politico y secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, de visita en Mongolia, y el embajador coreano en este pais, y por la de Mongolia, los miembros de la delegacion del Partido del Pueblo de Mongolia presidida por J. Munkhbat, secretario general del PPM, y el embajador mongol acreditado en Corea. 
					
					 J. Munkhbat dijo que la presente visita de la delegacion del PTC a Mongolia es un importante motivo en el desarrollo de las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises con la historia de mas de 60 anos. 
					
					 Expreso la voluntad de contribuir a ampliar y desarrollar el intercambio y cooperacion multifaceticos tradicionales entre los dos partidos y los dos paises. 
					
					 El mismo dia, J. Munkhbat ofrecio un banquete en honor de la delegacion del PTC. 
					
					 La delegacion coreana visito varios lugares de la capital y la localidad de Mongolia.

articles.title: En Pyongyang delegaciones al simposio internacional
articles.content:
En Pyongyang delegaciones al simposio internacional
 Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Arribaron el dia 22 a esta capital la delegacion de la Universidad Estatal de Mongolia, las delegaciones y delegados de varias universidades de China, incluyendo la Universidad del Pueblo, y el delegado de la Universidad de Paris 7 para participar en el simposio internacional de la Universidad Kim Il Sung.
					 Tambien llegaron los especialistas rusos en lengua coreana.
					
					 Con anterioridad, vinieron aqui el delegado de la Universidad de Liberacion de Berlin de Alemania, la delegacion de la Editorial de Educacion de Yanbian de China y la delegacion de la Universidad Coreana de la Chongryon (Asociacion General de Coreanos Residentes en Japon).

articles.title: Premier coreano visita Complejo Termoelectrico de Pukchang
articles.content:
Premier coreano visita Complejo Termoelectrico de Pukchang
 Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- El premier de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Pak Pong Ju, averiguo en el terreno las gestiones del Complejo Termoelectrico de Pukchang.
					 Recorriendo varios puntos del complejo, se cercioro del estado de suministro de carbon para la termoelectricidad y estimulo a los productores de electricidad.
					
					 En la reunion consultiva convocada en el terreno, fueron debatidos los problemas para organizar con precision la administracion y el mantenimiento tecnico de equipos y poner los generadores en pleno funcionamiento.
					
					 El premier exhorto a los obreros del complejo a mantener el honor de precursores en alcanzar la meta de produccion electrica, presentada por el Partido del Trabajo de Corea.
					
					 Por otra parte, Pak Pong Ju estuvo en la Mina de Carbon de Jenam del Complejo Carbonifero de la Zona de Tokchon.
					
					 Instruyo que la mina debe aumentar la extraccion del carbon anteponiendo las perforaciones fundamental y preparatoria a la produccion, y las unidades referentes, inclusive el Consejo de Ministros, deben fabricar y suministrar a tiempo los materiales como el riel de via estrecha, el cable de acero y entibo.
					
					 En su recorrido por el Metro de Pyongyang y el Almacen No. 1 de Pyongyang, el premier destaco la necesidad de mejorar el estado tecnico de los trenes electricos y de producir y suministrar variados articulos de industria ligera de buena calidad, conforme al gusto del pueblo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun critica la "guerra antiterrorista" de EE.UU.
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun critica la "guerra antiterrorista" de EE.UU.
 Pyongyang, 22 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Hace poco, el presidente estadounidense Obama dijo que llego el tiempo de perseguir al Estado Islamico y emprendera el ataque militar contra este con las fuerzas aliadas internacionales.
					 Continuo que "acabara con los terroristas que amenazan a Estados Unidos persiguiendolos hasta el final y no habra el refugio para los que amenacen a EE.UU.".
					
					 Anuncio tambien que atacara tambien a Siria expandiendo el ataque aereo contra Iraq y enviara nuevamente a este pais 475 efectivos norteamericanos.
					
					 Los dichos del mandatario norteamericano son una manifestacion de la invariable ambicion de EE.UU. de dominar todo el mundo con las fuerzas al emprender el nuevo ataque aereo contra los Estados soberanos como Siria bajo el rotulo de "exterminacion de los terroristas".
					
					 Al respecto, el diario Rodong Sinmun publico ayer un comentario individual que sigue:
					
					 Mediante la agresion ilegal, EE.UU. trata de derrocar a los paises independientes y establecer en ellos el orden y el regimen politico que le gusten. Esto es un crimen del terrorismo del Estado.
					
					 La "guerra antiterrorista" lanzada por EE.UU. es un acto ilegal que contraviene a la Carta de la ONU y al derecho internacional.
					
					 Aunque el imperio intenta justificar la "guerra antiterrorista" describiendola como "contribucion internacional" a la "libertad", "democracia" y "paz", no podra eludir jamas su caracter agresivo y reaccionario.
					
					 Al igual que el resultado de la "guerra antiterrorista" desplegada durante mas de 10 anos por EE.UU. en Iraq y Afganistan, el nuevo ataque aereo volvera a escenificar la matanza de numerosos civiles inocentes.
					
					 La escalada de "guerra antiterrorista" intranquilizara mas el mundo.
